content.body: sideshowbarker: those inis make android as passing and others with error
content.formatted_body: sideshowbarker: those inis make android as passing and others with error

content.body: but it is Android which is failing, no?
Yeah those ini files don't make much sense; a subtest can't get the status `OK` or `ERROR`, only a test file.
content.formatted_body: Yeah those ini files don't make much sense; a subtest can't get the status OK or ERROR, only a test file.

content.body:
I'd expect
```
[print-during-beforeunload.html]
  expected:
    if os == "android": ERROR
```

and similar for the other files.
content.formatted_body:
I'd expect

[print-during-beforeunload.html]
  expected:
    if os == "android": ERROR

and similar for the other files.

content.body: Ok, then I need to change those to cause the test to just not be run on Android, right?
Yeah you could do that as well if we're never going to implement `print()` on Android.
content.formatted_body: Yeah you could do that as well if we're never going to implement print() on Android.

content.body:
Which would be something like
```
[print-during-beforeunload.html]
  disabled:
    if os == "android": <bug link>
```
content.formatted_body:
Which would be something like

[print-during-beforeunload.html]
  disabled:
    if os == "android": <bug link>

content.body: or just keep the FAIL for android
Oh yeah, I guess my first suggestion is wrong if the test catches the exception, in which case it will be `FAIL`
content.formatted_body: Oh yeah, I guess my first suggestion is wrong if the test catches the exception, in which case it will be FAIL

content.body: For the subtest, not for the top-lvel test
